item.title: a rather short history of (believable) CG characters in movies
item.description:
a rather short history of (believable) CG characters in movies

UPDATE 05/28/2012: exchanged source video for 720p version, no big changes to the content, only small corrections to framing (4:3 --16:9), audio cleanup and 2 or 3 small changes to the edit. due to the 500MB upload limit for free members the bitrate is still rather low at 3200, so don't expect a massive quality boost....

item.title: How to Create a Customer Journey Map -
item.description:
How to Create a Customer Journey Map -

Despite best intentions and mountains of data, many organizations continue to offer lackluster experiences for their customers. Many organizations function with an internal focus, and that becomes apparent when customers interact with their various products, services and employees. Every interaction a customer has with an organization has an effect on satisfaction, loyalty, and the bottom line.

item.title: Seven Rare Steve Jobs Videos That Show How To "Think Different"
item.description:
Seven Rare Steve Jobs Videos That Show How To "Think Different"

This video shows rare footage of Steve Jobs from 1980 giving a talk about starting Apple. What's particularly striking is Jobs's explanation of man's skill as a toolmaker to amplify his inherent ability, which he says is why Apple was formed: not as many other companies were-to create a product-but instead to create tools that enhance man's innate talents.

item.title: Why a New Golden Age for UI Design Is Around the Corner
item.description:
Why a New Golden Age for UI Design Is Around the Corner

Over the past four years, the Walt Disney Company has been engaged in a secretive effort to redesign the Disney World experience. It'll go like this: You buy your ticket online and plan all the details of your visit. Then you'll get a wristband in the mail, which will be a passport to the experience that you've curated.

item.title: 10 Life Lessons from Calvin & Hobbes
item.description:
10 Life Lessons from Calvin & Hobbes

People debate if Hobbes is actually real - is he Calvin's conscience? His subconscious? But the only thing we can know for sure is that Hobbes is real to Calvin. And if he's real to Calvin, then Hobbes is real on some level, even if it's a level that we can't access ourselves.

item.title: An Idea That Changed the World
item.description:
An Idea That Changed the World

This is what happens when ordinary people stand up against our greatest threat. Join the fight: http://www.globalzero.org/

item.title: Design Thinking Comes of Age
item.description:
Design Thinking Comes of Age

Idea in Brief The Change Increasingly, corporations and professional services firms are working to create design-centric cultures. The Reason Many products, services, and processes are now technologically complex. People are not hardwired to deal well with high levels of complexity. They need help.

item.title: Mike Monteiro: Keynote
item.description:
Mike Monteiro: Keynote

This is "Mike Monteiro: Keynote" by ixdaglobal on Vimeo, the home for high quality videos and the people who love them.

item.title: This Ad Has a Secret Anti-Abuse Message That Only Kids Can See
item.description:
This Ad Has a Secret Anti-Abuse Message That Only Kids Can See

In an effort to provide abused children with a safe way to reach out for help, a Spanish organization called the Aid to Children and Adolescents at Risk Foundation, or ANAR for short, created an ad that displays a different message for adults and children at the same time.
